title: Mixed Reality-Based Team Training Program for Anatomy Practical Education

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamentals of medical terminology and histology
context.additional_context: Practice-oriented training for intermediate learners in managerial/leadership roles. Utilizes mixed reality (MR) content implementable in smartphone-based limited-technology environments.

learning_goals: Learners can accurately name structural features while exploring major human anatomy systems (e.g., musculoskeletal, circulatory) in 3D within a mixed reality environment
Learners can logically explain the associations between anatomical structures and functions while analyzing real clinical cases through Team-Based Learning (TBL)
Learners can perform virtual dissection simulations using MR technology and describe the location, relationships, and clinical significance of key structures according to evaluation criteria

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
